page.title: 20SOCIAL CONCERNS OF SANDHEAD
page.content: One must be in common with all rural areas in expressing the worries of lack of job prospects; constant depopulation - especially of younger elements; increasing numbers of old people choosing the peace and quiet of the country; lack of transport; high cost of living - especially such essentials as fuels for home and cars; and educational policies which do not support the smaller schools and their children, who have much longer days because of the distances they have to travel. In closing this last page I would say that despite the rather long list of worries, Sandhead and its environs - with its people, young AND old, is a wonderful place to live and work and it gives one so much pleasure that it is only when given the task of thinking about it that one realises what one has to worry about!
